required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment Strategy in Patients With High-risk of Postextubation Distress in ICU Based on a Lung Ultrasound Score Versus Standard Strategy
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment Strategy in Patients With High-risk of Postextubation Distress in ICU Based on a Lung Ultrasound Score Versus Standard Strategy

collaborator.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective, randomized clinical multicentric study in ICU during weaning from mechanical ventilation.

detailed_description.textblock: Prospective randomized clinical multicentric study on ICU comparing a treatment strategy (nasal humidified high flow therapy and Noninvasive Ventilation) in patients with high-risk of postextubation distress in ICU based on a Lung Ultrasound Score VERSUS standard strategy

primary_outcome.description: postextubation period requiring a ventilatory support (reintubation or curative Noninvasive ventilation).

secondary_outcome.description: Extubation failure within the 7 days following planned extubation

clinical_study.condition: Adult Patients Ventilated More Than 48 h

arm_group.description: Prospective randomized clinical multicentric study on ICU comparing a treatment strategy (nasal humidified high flow therapy and Noninvasive Ventilation) in patients with high-risk of postextubation distress in ICU based on a Lung Ultrasound Score VERSUS standard strategy

Prospective randomized clinical multicentric study on ICU comparing a treatment strategy (nasal humidified high flow therapy and Noninvasive Ventilation) in patients with high-risk of postextubation distress in ICU based on a Lung Ultrasound Score VERSUS standard strategy

intervention.description: Prospective randomized clinical multicentric study on ICU comparing a treatment strategy (nasal humidified high flow therapy and Noninvasive Ventilation) in patients with high-risk of postextubation distress in ICU based on a Lung Ultrasound Score VERSUS standard strategy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients ventilated more than 48 h
- Stable respiratory and hemodynamic conditions for SBT
- Consent of patients
- Arterial line
Exclusion Criteria:
- severe COBP
- Laryngeal dyspnea
- Tracheostomy
- Arrhythmia
- No echogenicity
- Paraplegia >T8
